data.title: Maksim Chmerkovskiy -- 5 things to know about the 'Dancing with the Stars' pro partner
data.meta_description: Maksim Chmerkovskiy -- 5 things to know about the 'Dancing with the Stars' pro partner. Maksim Chmerkovskiy -- 5 things to know about the Dancing with the Stars pro partner competing on Season 24.
data.text:
By Elizabeth Kwiatkowski, 03/20/2017

Maksim Chmerkovskiy will be competing on the upcoming edition of as a professional partner.

ADVERTISEMENT

Maksim, a 37-year-old ballroom dancer and choreographer -- who also served as a guest judge on several times -- will be paired with Glee star Heather Morris when Season 24 of the ABC reality dancing competition premieres Monday, March 20 at 8PM ET/PT.

Maksim joined in Season 2 and competed as a pro partner all the way up to Season 18 with the exceptions of Season 6, 16 and 17. He announced his DWTS retirement after winning Season 18 with Meryl Davis, but competed last season with Amber Rose, who ended up dating his little brother Val Chmerkovskiy.

Curious to learn more about the handsome 6'2" dancer who will show off his moves when returns?

Below is a list of 5 facts Reality TV World has compiled about Maksim Chmerkovskiy:

- He was born on January 17, 1980 in Odessa, Ukraine. His family immigrated to Brooklyn, NY in 1994, and with his father, Maksim opened up Rising Stars Dance Academy in New Jersey.

- Maksim is engaged to fellow pro Peta Murgatroyd. The couple just welcomed their first child together, son Shai Aleksander, on January 4, 2017.

Before he began dating Peta in 2012, Maksim was engaged to DWTS pro Karina Smirnoff for nine months.

- Maksim broke his right leg in a skiing accident at age 13 and had a titanium rod put in to stabilize his leg. Doctors predicted he'd have long-term difficulties, but he recovered and started dancing again six months later.

- He previously choreographed a commercial for Propel water and provided choreography for Zendaya's music video "Neverland" from Broadway's Finding Neverland.

Maksim also landed minor acting roles in the TV Land series The Exes and three episodes of General Hospital in 2013 playing the role of Anton Ivanov.

- In 2011, Maksim starred on the Ukrainian version of The Bachelor and got to date many beautiful women. One year later, he hosted the Ukrainian version of the game show The Cube.

He have also appeared as a judge on Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa, India's version of .
